summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (P5270.11) detailing the policies and procedures for the operation of Special Housing Units (SHUs), including administrative detention and disciplinary segregation. It outlines inmate placement criteria, review processes, conditions of confinement, and staff training requirements. The document is significant as it establishes the official BOP framework for restrictive housing in place at the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration.

events.title: Issuance of SHU Program Statement
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons issues updated Program Statement P5270.11 on Special Housing Units, rescinding the previous 2011 policy.

keyFacts: This is a standard BOP policy document (Program Statement P5270.11) on Special Housing Units (SHUs), not a case-specific record about Jeffrey Epstein.
The policy details two statuses for SHU placement: administrative detention (non-punitive) and disciplinary segregation (punitive).
It includes specific protections, stating that pregnant, post-partum, or post-miscarriage inmates should not be placed in restrictive housing except in rare, immediate risk situations.
The policy mandates regular reviews of SHU placement: within 3 work days, 7 calendar days, and every 30 days thereafter.
It outlines conditions of confinement, including requirements for exercise, medical/mental health care, and limits on the use of alternate clothing/linen or meal status.
